title: Zuckerberg’s Twitter clone Threads is live. Here’s what we love and hate about it.
description: Meta's Threads may be the first Twitter alternative that really matters because it’s built on top of Instagram’s existing base of billions of users.

title: State Dept. cancels Facebook meetings after judge’s ‘censorship’ ruling
description: A Louisiana federal court’s order limiting the Biden administration’s communications with tech firms already is disrupting efforts to fight misinformation.

title: In Big Tech layoffs, cooks and janitors are hit hardest
description: Amid a wave of tech company layoffs, contract workers such as on-site cooks and janitors receive the lowest severance packages.

title: How elite schools like Stanford became fixated on the AI apocalypse
description: Student-led groups focused on AI Safety have popped up at Stanford University and other schools, backed by billionaires fixated on the AI apocalypse

title: Two screens? None at all? Laptops lure new buyers with dramatic designs.
description: We’re entering an age of truly strange portable computers — but should they replace your conventional laptop?
